title: Ticket #7506: Interactive job executable command different with submission file
description:
The code in src/condor_examples/interactive.sub now uses: 
executable = /bin/sh
arguments = "-c 'sleep 180 && while test -d ${_CONDOR_SCRATCH_DIR}/.condor_ssh_to_job_1; do /bin/sleep 3; done'"
This is used if the user does not specify an interactive submit file: 
condor_submit -interactive
This fixes the issue that Singularity interactive jobs are killed after 180 seconds.

However, the code in src/condor_submit.V6/submit.cpp uses: 

if ( !InteractiveSubmitFile ) {
  extraLines.Append( "executable=/bin/sleep" );
  extraLines.Append( "transfer_executable=false" );
  extraLines.Append( "arguments=180" );
}
as was used in previous versions. This is used when the user supplies a custom file, for example: 
condor_submit -interactive mysub.jdl
and with Singularity interactive jobs causes them to be terminated after 180 seconds, so this code also needs to be adapted to be consistent.
